original_title: Sri Lanka rupee opens weaker, bond yields up
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka’s rupee opened at 301.35/55 to the US dollar in the spot market Wednesday, weaker from 301.00/15 a day earlier, while bond yields edged up.
In the secondary market, a bond maturing 15.12.2026 was quoted at 8.10/20 percent, from 8.05/15 percent.
A bond maturing on 15.09.2027 was quoted at 8.45/55 percent, flat.
A bond maturing on 15.12.2028 was quoted at 8.98/9.00 percent.
A bond maturing on 15.10.2029 was quoted at 9.48/50 percent.
A bond maturing on 15.12.2029 was quoted at 9.50/53 percent marginally up from 9.48/52 percent.
A bond maturing on 15.12.2032 was quoted at 10.36/46 percent.
A bond maturing on 01.06.2033 was quoted at 10.67/75 percent, from 10.70/90 percent.
A bond maturing on 15.09.2034 was quoted at 10.85/95 percent.
Sticks opened up; The ASPI was up 0.35%, or 66.72 points, at 19,012. The S&P SL20 was up 0.34%, or 19.62 points, at 5,720. (Colombo/Jul16/2025)
